intro: Phyllanthus taitensis, commonly known as the Taiti phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific islands of French Polynesia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, waxy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal or lowland areas. Its botanical features include a stout stem, opposite leaf arrangement, and yellowish-green flowers that are usually borne in dense inflorescences. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
